result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge unless previously paid. Pay all costs and surcharges to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds and wages. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court advised defendant he will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing; pay surcharge.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Attend a Cognitive Thinking class.
- Court ordered the same conditions be set as ordered in case 13CF4677.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Lamar McFadden

records.addlTxt: The petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest. Signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's petition for sentence adjustment under sec. 973.195, Stats. returned as untimely.

Defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation. Plea hearing proceeded. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Attorney Devitt and ADA McNutt have set this matter for final pretrial before Branch 25 on 9/10/15 at 8:30 a.m.

/from Chief Deputy District Attorney Kent Lovern, received and filed with:
 - Request for Prompt Disposition.
Per the substitution request by defense against Judge Conen.  Judge Rothstein is now the assigned court (as of 08-01-2015, Judge Moroney's calendar transfers to Judge Rothstein.)
by defense against Judge Conen; filed.  Judge Rothstein's Court is now the assigned court.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Jury Trial today.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
Also, State needs time to review some discovery reports.
Statements made.

**  Request for substitution made by defense counsel.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Jeffrey Conen, Branch 30.  Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case, pursuant to current court rules, to Judge Stephanie Rothstein, Branch 25.  

Case adjourned for Adjourned Jury Trial on 10-14-2015 at 8:30 AM - Branch 25, Judge Rothstein's Court.
filed by Atty. Anne Devitt on behalf of the defendant.
of Alibi filed by Atty. Anne Devitt on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Final Pretrial Conference held.
Court addressed defense's notice of alibi.
Court accepts filing of the notice of alibi.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 06-03-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
FILED, MOTION IN LIMINE
FILED, DEFENDANT'S PROPOSED JURY INSTRUCTIONS
filed by ADA Sarah McNutt on behalf of the State.
filed by ADA Sarah McNutt on behalf of the State.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial dates.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 05-07-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 06-03-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request another scheduling conference date.
Case adjourned to 03-03-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing JANUARY 12, 2015  received and filed. (17 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Anne Devitt  SPD  819 N 6th Street  9th Floor  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Affirmation for the state:Gregory Borst-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CAROL M. OR HER RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Daniel Lamar McFadden in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
